thread.title: Trump wants to build up US nuclear weapons
thread.title_full: Trump wants to build up US nuclear weapons | Washington Examiner

author: Kyle Feldscher
title: Trump wants to build up US nuclear weapons
text:
President Trump plans on building up the United States' nuclear arsenal and doesn't support the New START treaty that currently limits the amount of nuclear weapons in possession of the U.S. and Russia.
Reuters reported Trump said in an interview he wants to make the American nuclear arsenal the "top of the pack" and that the U.S. is behind on its nuclear weapons capacity.
He called the New START treaty "one-sided" and doesn't support it in its current form. The treaty is set to expire next year.
New START limits the American and Russian nuclear arsenals to 700 deployed intercontinental ballistic missiles, submarine-launched ballistic missiles and heavy bombers used to drop bombs; 1,500 nuclear warheads on those missiles; and 800 total launchers for all those missiles.
Subscribe today to get intelligence and analysis on defense and national security issues in your Inbox each weekday morning from veteran journalists Jamie McIntyre and Jacqueline Klimas.
  the Daily on Defense newsletter.   issue soon! The deal also allows the U.S. and Russia to monitor each other's nuclear capabilities through inspections and other methods.
Trump complained to Reuters about Russia deploying a cruise missile that appears to be a violation of an arms control treaty, and he plans to raise the issue with Russian President Vladimir Putin.
Trump also mentioned his unhappiness with North Korea's testing of ballistic missiles and called on China to help solve the national security problem caused by the reclusive dictatorship.
